message: i'm trying to learn django/python and I need some more advanced tutorials now (enouth polls and blogs... lol)
watched your great tutorial @ ShowMeDo. Wish you could make an updated version of it, with commons topics such as extending user models, using Facebook and Twitter accounts integration, etc
Sorry, pretty busy these days with working on Convore :)
I really wish I had a better answer than that
Well good luck with it my friend, I look forward to seeing it, if it's a public thing
@gcmartinelli IMO the best way to learn is to build something you actually want
lol, i imagined... just joking. i was surprised to see that you are a member of the team. great work
yeah, i'm doing that also. should release somethign in the next weeks :) but It's looking like a frankenstein, sometimes I have no idea what I'm doing. a lot of rebuilding involved!
@gcmartinelli Thanks for the tip. I haven't used ShowMeDo nearly enough.
There are like 8 episodes - maybe that helps.
@ericflo Those showmedo tutorials got me started with Django. Thanks alot!@

Nothing much to add to this topic except to say another HUGE thanks to @ericflo for the Django From The Ground Up series. The screencasts are what got me excited about Django and gave me the jump-start that I really needed at the time. You're an absolute rockstar, best of luck with Convore!
@ericflo A little late to the party, but huge thanks from another proud member of "The School of Flo". :D
One suggestion I might make is for those of you who want tutorial things.. write up a simple document detailing what it is you'd actually like to know.
Lots of folks are often looking for things to write about, and knowing the people actually want to know about something is a really good incentive to writing about it.
StartTheDark got me started, and helped me land my first (and current) post-university job. Forever grateful, @ericflo
